comment:
* DOMLocator is an interface that describes a location (e.g. * where an error occurred). *

See also the Document Object Model (DOM) Level 3 Core Specification. * @since DOM Level 3

methods.name: public int getLineNumber()
methods.comment: * The line number this locator is pointing to, or -1 if * there is no column number available.

methods.name: public int getColumnNumber()
methods.comment: * The column number this locator is pointing to, or -1 if * there is no column number available.

methods.name: public int getByteOffset()
methods.comment: * The byte offset into the input source this locator is pointing to or * -1 if there is no byte offset available.

methods.name: public int getUtf16Offset()
methods.comment: * The UTF-16, as defined in [Unicode] and Amendment 1 of [ISO/IEC 10646], offset into the input source this locator is pointing to or * -1 if there is no UTF-16 offset available.

methods.name: public Node getRelatedNode()
methods.comment: * The node this locator is pointing to, or null if no node * is available.

methods.name: public String getUri()
methods.comment: * The URI this locator is pointing to, or null if no URI is * available.
